alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Koolau Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 22 at 8:09AM HST until January 23 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI...THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND THE WEST FACING SHORES OF BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE WEST FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND LANAI... .An XXL west-northwest to northwest (300-320 degree) swell will produce extremely dangerous giant size surf. Coastal water overwash may occur across many low lying roadways along northern and western facing shorelines, especially during periods of high tide. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous large breaking waves between 45 to 55 feet along the north facing shores of Niihau Kauai Oahu Molokai and Maui...25 to 35 feet along the west facing shores of Niihau Kauai Oahu and Molokai. Surf rising to 12 to 16 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...Portions of Kauai, Maui, Molokai, Niihau, Oahu and the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...Very High. Expect strong breaking waves and powerful currents with ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, periodically overtopping vulnerable coastal roadways with localized beach erosion. Wave runup could impact coastal properties and infrastructure, especially during morning high tide. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present. Surges and strong currents inside exposed harbors could cause damage to boats due to the jostling of boats and floating docks. Waves breaking in channel entrances may make navigating these channels dangerous.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
